intro: Paliavana tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered paliavana, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, pale flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It has a short stem with hairy surfaces and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
